QuizletFinal:
*good*
adjective: good.
"Ella es una buena amiga." - She is a good friend.

*there was*
verb: have.
Había una vez una princesa. - Once upon a time there was a princess.

*come*
verb: see, view, watch.
Ven conmigo al parque. Come with me to the park.

*three*
noun: three
: three.
Tres amigos caminaron juntos. - Three friends walked together.

*less*
adjective: less, fewer, minus
adverb: less, least, minus
preposition: less, minus, but.
"Menos hablamos, mejor." - The less we talk, the better.

*has to*
noun: debit
phrase: you may.
"Debe estudiar más para aprobar el examen." - He must study more in order to pass the exam.

*had*
noun: tapeworm.
Tenía mucho trabajo que hacer. - She had a lot of work to do.

*evil*
noun: evil, wrong, ill
adverb: wrong, badly, poorly
adjective: troubled.
"Ella está mal" - She is not well.

*with me*
.
"Vamos contigo y conmigo." - Let's go with you and me.

*mother*
noun: mother, parent.
Mi madre me enseñó a cocinar. - My mother taught me how to cook.

*today*
adverb: today
noun: today.
Hoy es mi cumpleaños. - Today is my birthday.

*who*
pronoun: whoever, whosoever.
"¿Quién te dijo eso?" - Who told you that?

*been*
verb: be, come, come of.
"Ha sido un placer conocerte" - It has been a pleasure to meet you.

*mother*
noun: mom, mum, mother.
"Mi mamá me compra comida todos los días." - My mom buys me food every day.

*have*
verb: have, keep, own.
Tienen que hacerlo. - They have to do it.

*then*
adverb: then, later, next
adjective: early.
Luego iremos a la playa. - Afterwards, we will go to the beach.

*all*
adjective: all, whole, entire.
Todas las personas tienen derechos iguales. 
All people have equal rights.

*over there*
adverb: there, yonder.
"Allí está mi casa." - "There is my house."

*all*
adjective: all, whole, entire.
Toda la comida estaba deliciosa. - All the food was delicious.

*hour*
noun: hour, time, tour
abbreviation: hr..
"Es la una de la tarde." - It is one o'clock in the afternoon.

*women*
noun: woman.
La mujer es inteligente. - The woman is intelligent.

*seen*
adjective: viewed.
"Lo he visto antes." - I have seen it before.

*you do*
verb: do, make, ask.
"¿Qué haces?" - "What are you doing?"

*matter*
verb: import, matter, amount to.
No importa si está lloviendo. - It doesn't matter if it's raining.

*with you*
pronoun: with you
noun: love.
"Me gusta estar contigo" - I like being with you.

*go*
interjection: Cave!.
"Ve a la biblioteca." - Go to the library.

*late*
noun: afternoon, evening, eve
adjective: late
adverb: late.
"Hoy llegué tarde al trabajo." - "I arrived late to work today."

*hey*
interjection: Here!, Look here!, Hark!.
Oye, ¡mira! - Hey, look!

*part*
noun: part, party, portion
pronoun: some.
La parte más difícil fue cuando tuvimos que mudarnos. - The hardest part was when we had to move.

*to have*
verb: have
noun: assets, havings.
"Habían estado allí antes." - They had been there before.

*men*
noun: men, menfolk.
Los hombres están trabajando afuera. - The men are working outside.

*problem*
noun: problem, issue, trouble.
"Tengo un problema con mi computadora." - I have a problem with my computer.

*further*
adjective: more, most, plus
adverb: more, most, other
noun: more, plus
suffix: most.
"Siempre quiero más." - I always want more.

*know*
verb: know, realize, taste
noun: knowledge, learning, wit.
"No sé cómo hacerlo" - I don't know how to do it.

*wanted to*
auxiliary verb: would.
Quería salir a caminar. - I wanted to go for a walk.

*still*
adverb: even, yet, still.
Aún no hemos terminado el proyecto. - We still haven't finished the project.

*times*
noun: times.
"A veces me siento triste" - "Sometimes I feel sad"

*our*
.
Nuestra casa está muy bonita. - Our house is very nice.

*do it*
.
"Voy a hacerlo mañana." - I'm going to do it tomorrow.

*each*
adjective: each, every
pronoun: each, every.
Cada día trabajo duro. - I work hard every day.

*did*
verb: do, make, ask.
"Él hizo su tarea." - He did his homework.

*I see*
verb: see, view, watch.
Veo una ardilla en el árbol. - I see a squirrel in the tree.

*so much*
adverb: so, how
adjective: such
noun: point, score, touchdown.
Tanto tiempo hemos estado esperando. - We have been waiting for so long.

*reason*
noun: reason, ratio, rate.
"La razón por la que estoy aquí es para aprender español." - The reason I am here is to learn Spanish.

*you*
pronoun: you.
Ustedes son muy inteligentes. - You all are very intelligent.

*idea*
noun: idea, thought, concept.

*those*
adjective: those.
Esos son mis libros. - Those are my books.

*go*
verb: go, be, head.
Ellos van al parque. - They are going to the park.

*maybe*
interjection: Wonder!.
Quizá me gustaría ir al cine esta noche. - Perhaps I would like to go to the movies tonight.

*I must*
verb: must, owe, job.
Debo ir a la escuela. - I must go to school.

*some*
pronoun: any.
"¿Tienes alguna pregunta?" - Do you have any questions?

*TRUE*
adjective: certain, sure, definite
adverb: in the bag.
"Es cierto que tengo que hacer mi tarea antes de salir." - It is true that I have to do my homework before leaving.

*You*
pronoun: you.
"¿Cómo está Ud.?" - "How are you?"

*dead*
adjective: dead, deceased, lifeless
noun: dead, dead man, deceased.
"El perro estaba muerto cuando llegamos." - The dog was dead when we arrived.

*some*
adverb: about, some
adjective: few, some
pronoun: some.
"Ella compró unos libros." - She bought some books.

*these*
adjective: these
pronoun: these, these ones.
Estos son mis libros. - These are my books.

*go out*
verb: leave, get out, go out.
Salí a caminar con mis amigos. - I went out for a walk with my friends.

*police*
noun: police, policeman, cop.
"La policía está buscando al ladrón." - The police are looking for the thief.

*really*
adverb: really, actually, truly.
"Realmente me gusta la comida mexicana." - "I really like Mexican food."

*too much*
adverb: too, too much, overly.
Demasiado tarde para arreglarlo. Too late to fix it.

*family*
noun: family, household, kin.
Mi familia es muy importante para mí. - My family is very important to me.

*they can*
verb: be able to, can, may.
"Pueden venir con nosotros." - They can come with us.

*head*
noun: head, top, lead.
"La cabeza duele mucho." - "The head hurts a lot."

*we have*
verb: have.
Hemos decidido quedarnos en casa. 
We have decided to stay at home.

*friends*
noun: friend, buddy, chum
adjective: friendly.
"Mis amigos son muy importantes para mí." - My friends are very important to me.

*girl*
noun: girl, gal, cutie.
La chica es muy bonita. - The girl is very pretty.

*dear*
noun: honey, affection, love.
"Te quiero mucho, cariño." - "I love you a lot, darling."

*side*
noun: side, end, part.
"Siempre hay un lado positivo." - There is always a positive side.

*there*
adverb: there, thither, yonder.
"Allá está el parque." - There is the park over there.

*between*
preposition: between, among, amongst
adverb: in between.
Entre la clase y el recreo hay una hora de tiempo.
Translation: Between the class and the break there is an hour of time.

*minutes*
noun: minute.
Los minutos pasan rápidamente. - The minutes pass quickly.

*say*
verb: say, tell, speak.
"Digo que tengo que irme ahora." - I say that I have to go now.

*some*
adjective: some
pronoun: any.
Algunos días son mejores que otros. - Some days are better than others.

*Serious*
adjective: serious, earnest, severe.
"Él es muy serio." - He is very serious.

*careful*
noun: care, attention, nursing.
"Ten cuidado al cruzar la calle." - "Be careful when crossing the street."

*passed*
noun: step, passage, pass.
"Ayer, pasó algo muy extraño." - Yesterday, something very strange happened.

*hello good*
.

*are*
verb: be, come, come of.
Somos amigos. = We are friends.

*love*
noun: love, passion.
"Amor es la luz que ilumina el camino de la vida." - Love is the light that illuminates the path of life.

*door*
noun: door, gate, doorway.
La puerta está cerrada. - The door is closed.

*you see*
verb: see, view, watch.
"¿Ves lo que está pasando?" - Do you see what is happening?

*Oh*
.
Vaya con Dios. - Go with God.

*oh*
interjection: Ha!, Ahoy!.

*luck*

*Hey*
.

*fast*
adjective: fast, quick, rapid
noun: rapid, rapids, riffle.

*account*
noun: account, count, bill.
"La cuenta es de $50." - The bill is $50.

*maybe*
adverb: perhaps, maybe, possibly.
Quizás mañana iré a la playa. - Maybe I'll go to the beach tomorrow.

*those*
adjective: those.

*well*
conjunction: since, then
adverb: then, well.

*past*
adjective: past, last, preterit
noun: past, foretime, background
preposition: beyond.
"Ayer fue un día pasado." - Yesterday was a past day.

*I thought*
verb: think, reflect, ponder.

*still*
adverb: still, yet, as yet.

*brother*
noun: brother, sibling, sib.

*you must*
phrase: you may.
Debes estudiar para el examen. - You must study for the exam.

*almost*
adverb: almost, nearly, about
preposition: near, next.

*shape*
noun: form, way, shape.
"La forma en que hablamos dice mucho sobre nosotros." - The way we speak says a lot about us.

*here*
adverb: here, hither.
Aquí estamos preparando la fiesta. - Here we are preparing the party.

*boy*
noun: boy, kid, child
adjective: small, little.

*okay*
.
